column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Healthcare is at the top of the list of provincial and local issues .
#Text=There are still an estimated one million Ontarians without a doctor , and my riding is no exception .
#Text=We have also suffered from chronic under-funding for healthcare .
#Text=A PC government would ensure there is catch-up funding for Durham and other GTA-905 communities as well as any other areas of rapid growth .
#Text=This will allow local hospitals to continue to provide the outstanding care Durham residents depend upon .
#Text=The local economy is foremost in the minds of Durham residents .
#Text=Ontario has been hit hard by the loss of an estimated 140,000 good jobs in the manufacturing sector .
#Text=The Oshawa / Durham area is no exception .
#Text=All levels of government along with unions , business , education , and individuals citizens must work together to build a strong local economy based on energy , manufacturing and agriculture .
#Text=Durham Riding also faces quality of life issues that include gridlock and the need for improved public transit , support for agriculture/rural communities , and protection of our environment .
#Text=What should be the first order of business in the 39th Legislative Assembly ?
#Text=Restoring trust and confidence in government .

#Text=The past four years have been marred by dozens of broken promises from a government that promised not to raise taxes on the campaign trail and then introduced the $ 2.6 billion-per-year health tax .
#Text=Other broken promises range from tackling gridlock on our highways to closing the coal-powered generating stations .
#Text=Are the property taxes in your riding at a fair level for the amount of services received in the municipality ?
#Text=When property assessment rises suddenly over a few years , it puts pressure on retirees and persons on modest incomes who own a house .
#Text=I fully support a five per cent cap on the annual assessment increase for as long as an individual owns his or her home .
#Text=In addition , the Municipal Property Assessment Corporation should be required to justify higher assessment instead of demanding that homeowners prove why their assessment is too high .
#Text=Ontario can do better in forging a new partnership between the provincial government and municipalities .
#Text=Local taxes should be used primarily for local needs and not to pay for provincial programs unfairly imposed on a community .
#Text=There should be long-term , multi-year funding arrangements for municipalities .
#Text=A PC government under John Tory is committed to speed up the municipal review process so that we can start the reforms before the next provincial budget .
#Text=How can the province lead the way in stimulating job creation ?

#Text=By reducing the burden of red tape on small business , reducing inter-provincial trade barriers , helping to create a skilled workforce , lowering taxes for individuals as well as lowering the business capital tax , providing a stable , affordable supply of electricity and by encouraging innovations .
